meanings.definition: A person or company that helps facilitate the shipment and delivery of goods.
meanings.sent1: The expeditors ensured the packages reached their destinations on time.
meanings.sent2: The expeditors at the shipping company worked efficiently to deliver the goods.
meanings.sent3: The expeditors joked that they were like Santa's little helpers, making sure all the presents were delivered.
meanings.sent4: The expeditors were the unsung heroes of the logistics world, always ensuring smooth deliveries.
meanings.sent5: The expeditors' dedication to timely deliveries made them invaluable to the company.

meanings.definition: A person who expedites or hastens a process or task.
meanings.sent1: The expeditors in the office were known for their ability to speed up paperwork.
meanings.sent2: As an expeditor, she always found ways to streamline the workflow.
meanings.sent3: The expeditors decided to have a race to see who could finish their tasks first.
meanings.sent4: His efficiency as an expeditor was like a turbo boost for the project.
meanings.sent5: The expeditors' swift actions saved the team a lot of time and effort.
